llm_results: [{"detection_name": "LLM: html_injection", "detection": "vulnerable", "category": "Injection Attacks", "description": "The GraphQL error response reflects attacker-controlled input containing an HTML tag (an payload) in the 'url' field. Although the payload is percent-encoded in the JSON, this is clear evidence of reflected HTML content originating from user-supplied data. If any client or UI decodes and inserts this value into an HTML context without proper escaping, the injected markup could execute (reflected XSS/HTML injection). The server also discloses error details that echo the input, increasing the risk. Whether exploitation is immediate depends on how the URL is rendered by consuming applications, but the presence of the raw HTML payload in the response constitutes a valid HTML injection finding.", "evidence": "errors[0].extensions.response.url = \"http://localhost:8080/api/episode/%3Cimg%20src=x%20onerror=alert(1)%3E,2\"", "confidence": 0.85, "llm_analysis": {"is_vulnerable": true, "vulnerability_type": "html_injection", "severity": "HIGH", "confidence": 0.85, "evidence": "errors[0].extensions.response.url = \"http://localhost:8080/api/episode/%3Cimg%20src=x%20onerror=alert(1)%3E,2\"", "explanation": "The GraphQL error response reflects attacker-controlled input containing an HTML tag (an payload) in the 'url' field. Although the payload is percent-encoded in the JSON, this is clear evidence of reflected HTML content originating from user-supplied data. If any client or UI decodes and inserts this value into an HTML context without proper escaping, the injected markup could execute (reflected XSS/HTML injection). The server also discloses error details that echo the input, increasing the risk. Whether exploitation is immediate depends on how the URL is rendered by consuming applications, but the presence of the raw HTML payload in the response constitutes a valid HTML injection finding."}}]

[{"detection_name": "LLM: Introspection", "detection": "potential", "category": "Injection Attacks", "description": "The GraphQL response includes an '__type' object with the type name 'Episode' and a full list of its fields and types. This is direct evidence that GraphQL introspection is enabled and returning schema metadata. Introspection disclosure allows an attacker to enumerate types, fields, and type details which aids in crafting targeted queries or finding other weaknesses. While not an immediate remote-execution flaw, it is an information disclosure that increases attack surface; recommended mitigation is to disable or restrict introspection in production (or enforce strict access control) to reduce exposure.", "evidence": "\"__type\": { \"name\": \"Episode\", \"fields\": [ { \"name\": \"id\", ... }, { \"name\": \"name\", ... }, ... ] }", "confidence": 0.95, "llm_analysis": {"is_vulnerable": true, "vulnerability_type": "Introspection", "severity": "MEDIUM", "confidence": 0.95, "evidence": "\"__type\": { \"name\": \"Episode\", \"fields\": [ { \"name\": \"id\", ... }, { \"name\": \"name\", ... }, ... ] }", "explanation": "The GraphQL response includes an '__type' object with the type name 'Episode' and a full list of its fields and types. Introspection disclosure allows an attacker to enumerate types, fields, and type details which aids in crafting targeted queries or finding other weaknesses. While not an immediate remote-execution flaw, it is an information disclosure that increases attack surface; recommended mitigation is to disable or restrict introspection in production (or enforce strict access control) to reduce exposure."}}]
